decks.notes: The deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful threats and control spells. It aims to control the game by using cards like Karn Liberated and Oblivion Stone to remove key threats from the opponent's board, while also having access to powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes utility cards like Relic of Progenitus and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) in order to generate a large amount of mana quickly. With this mana, the deck aims to control the board using powerful spells like Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, All Is Dust, and Oblivion Stone. The deck also includes powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Sundering Titan to finish off the opponent once the control is established. Finally, the deck uses cantrips like Chromatic Sphere and Ancient Stirrings to find the necessary pieces efficiently.

This aggro deck focuses on a proactive playstyle, utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets along with powerful control elements like Cryptic Command and Remand. The deck aims to apply early pressure with its creatures while maintaining tempo and disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal spells. Vedalken Shackles serves as additional disruption, allowing the deck to steal opposing threats. Overall, this deck seeks to quickly close out games through a combination of aggressive creatures and versatile control elements.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively and utilizing a diverse range of lands to support its powerful multicolored spells. It includes a mix of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Geist of Saint Traft, alongside versatile spells such as Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile. The deck also benefits from the mana acceleration provided by Noble Hierarch and uses creatures like Wild Nacatl and Kird Ape to quickly pressure opponents. With a strong mix of threats and removal, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of versatile creatures that can be searched for and put into play using cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling. The key strategy is to use the creatures to disrupt the opponent's plans, gain incremental advantages, and eventually combo off with cards like Archangel of Thune and Spike Feeder. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay to control the game until the combo can be executed. The mana base is designed to support the various colored requirements of the toolbox creatures.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures with varying abilities to create powerful combinations and synergies. The goal is to utilize Birthing Pod to efficiently tutor for and play creatures that disrupt the opponent's strategy or generate value for your own game plan. By carefully sequencing your creature selections and utilizing cards like Chord of Calling, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a versatile array of threats while also benefiting from the incremental life gain and growth provided by cards like Archangel of Thune and Gavony Township.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board presence and tempo advantage using cheap creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Tarmogoyf, while also disrupting opponent's strategies with countermagic and removal spells. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent and maintain control of the game through efficient card draw and versatile spells like Snapcaster Mage and Lightning Bolt. The mana base is carefully constructed to provide consistent access to all three colors of mana for optimal card plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing Birthing Pod to create a toolbox of creatures with different abilities that can be searched for and played at the right time to disrupt the opponent's game plan and create powerful synergies. The deck includes a variety of creatures with enter the battlefield triggers and various abilities to allow for flexibility in different matchups. The use of mana dorks such as Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch helps to ramp up and accelerate the deck's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents by assembling strong creature combinations.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to maintain pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Grim Lavamancer, Snapcaster Mage, and Young Pyromancer, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Mana Leak, Remand, Spell Pierce, and Spell Snare. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Pillar of Flame to deal direct damage to the opponent or remove threats. Card draw and selection with Gitaxian Probe and Serum Visions help ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. The addition of Sword of Fire and Ice provides additional damage and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to pump them up for a fast, aggressive strategy. The key strategy involves using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to quickly ramp up mana, while also utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager to sacrifice artifacts and turn them into threats. With a mix of efficient creatures and powerful buffs, this deck seeks to overwhelm opponents before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck aims to control the game by using powerful board wipes and countermagic spells to disrupt the opponent's strategies. It also utilizes the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast game-ending threats like Elesh Norn, Emrakul, and Iona. The deck also has access to graveyard recursion through Unburial Rites and Gifts Ungiven, providing additional versatility and resilience. By efficiently managing resources and outpacing the opponent, this deck can dominate the late game and secure victory.

This deck relies on a fast and aggressive strategy centered around Merfolk creatures. By utilizing lords that pump up the power and toughness of all Merfolk, along with disruption and protection from cards like Kira, Great Glass-Spinner and Thassa, God of the Sea, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. Spreading Seas can disrupt opponent's mana base while drawing cards, while Aether Vial allows for cheating creatures into play at instant speed. With a solid mana base and a focus on synergy within the Merfolk tribe, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield early on.

The deck utilizes a wide variety of creatures with varying abilities to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By using cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling, the deck can search for and put these creatures into play to create powerful combos or answers to threats from the opponent. This deck aims to control the board and gain incremental advantage through the use of its versatile creatures, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using Cranial Plating to boost their power and toughness. It also includes burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Shrapnel Blast for additional damage. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer to increase the threat level of the board. The deck's mana base is built around artifact lands and mana-producing artifacts like Mox Opal, allowing for consistent and efficient casting of spells.

The deck focuses on using Birthing Pod to tutor for and chain together creatures that have powerful interactions with each other. It aims to create a toolbox of creatures that can both disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate value for the player. The deck utilizes a variety of combo pieces such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch, as well as powerful toolbox creatures like Kitchen Finks and Restoration Angel. By continuously tutoring for the right creature for the situation, the deck can adapt to various board states and outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast powerful late-game threats such as Wurmcoil Engine and Sundering Titan. The deck also includes control elements like Condescend, Remand, and Repeal to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect key threats. Additionally, cards like Expedition Map and Treasure Mage help tutor for specific pieces needed for the combo. Ultimately, the goal is to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with sheer power and card advantage.
